creator: sauli.karhu@codeonline.com
text:
C:\PROGRA~1\java_extras\jakarta-jmeter\bin>CALL ..\lcp ..\lib\ant-1.3.jar

JMeter works fine otherwise, but when trying to load a saved test plan, I get:

Error loading class org.apache.xerces.parsers.SAXParser  : class is not found
java.lang.NullPointerException
. . .

Shouldn't the distributed xerces.jar work automatically when running jmeter.bat?

creator: jflagg@alumni.utexas.net
text:
I found the reason for this... In the config file jmeter.properties there are 
two spaces at the end of the line 

xml.parser=org.apache.xerces.parsers.SAXParser

So it is trying to load the class "org.apache.xerces.parsers.SAXParser  " 
instead of "org.apache.xerces.parsers.SAXParser"

I deleted this two spaces and it worked fine.

I thought we addressed this by trimming the classnames before trying to load them?

Please note: anywhere we do class.forName() or equivalent, we *must* trim the
class name as an extra precaution.  That way we can be more resilient to these
configuration errors.
